Dude, it's Half Life!

Shorter than I expected, but otherwise enjoyable. It reminded me that a lot of the magic inherent to Half-Life lies in the sense of reactivity in the environments and the characters (see: Alyx quipping when I took a wrong turn navigating a vent). Even in this tiny expansion, the level design felt, if not fresh, then at least well-paced.

Overall an improvement. Keep in mind that Alyx will be with you the whole time so it's going to seem more ''guided'' than the base game, but still retaining that sense of exploration.

Out of all the Half Life games I'm convinced this is the best one. From the opening scene to tooling around unarmed with Alyx to some great last stand fights later in the game it's just great.

Episode 2 was okay but it's always associated with Valve giving up on making games. Makes it hard to enjoy. Episode 1 though, so many good memories. The world was a lot brighter in my eyes when this game came out.

Love it, best series ever

Really enjoyed this episode.  Basically picks up where HL2 ended. You’re just outside of the Citadel after you’ve destroyed the main reactor.  Neither you or Alyx know how you survived the blast or how you reached the base of the citadel safely.  You go back into the Citadel to rescue Alyx’s father Eli and spend half the game there solving various puzzles with the gravity gun and decimating the combine.  The other half takes place in City 17 where you are rescuing rebel forces and must defteat a powerful Strider in an epic final battle.  Once you defeat it you escape the city on a train and witness a blast wave coming from the citadel headed toward the train.  Ends there.  10/10

Hayatımın çeşitli dönemlerinde birkaç defa oynadığım ve ayrıca Cinematic Mod ile final yaptığım Half-Life 2 serisinin bendeki yeri oldukça özeldir. Bunu ayrıntılara dökmüyorum zira çoğunuzun benimle aynı fikirde olduğunu düşünüyorum. Nesilden nesile aktarılması gereken oyunlar olsaydı herhalde Half-Life 2 serisi bunu hakeden birkaç oyundan birisi olurdu. NOT: 2020 Eylül ayında Half-Life 2 nostaljisi yapıp tüm seriyi +steam başarımları ile tekrar oynadım ve şuan bile rahatlıkla tavsiye edebilirim.
10/10 again for Half-Life

Классно было вернуться в этот мир. Игра коротенькая, но от того не менее увлекательная, впереди ещё второй эпизод, который, надеюсь, поставит точку в этой истории. Хотя судя по отзывам фанатов и ожиданию 3 части, я не получу ответы на свои вопросы. Всё равно рекомендую эту игру тем, кто прошёл Half-Life 2, и хочет увидеть, что было дальше

Тут исправили все косяки Half Life 2. Теперь от Аликс появилась польза и она активно помогает в бою. Муравьиные львы стали настоящей угрозой а не пушечным мясом. Начало игры где нужно постоянно освещать себе путь фонариком особенно понравилось. Напрягали только заскриптованые двери за которыми стояли и зомби и которые открывались только если дойти до определённой точки. В остальном всё шикарно. игра динамичная и не даёт заскучать. 9/10

This episode of Half Life 2 is a good short game. Though it can be annoying and boring at someparts, it is still worth playing. The game is only 2 hours long and has an interesting storyline. It also shows what happens after Half Life 2. Overall, it is a pretty good game and worth it.

Great game again made by Valve. Although it's very short, the story & mission is very nice. Never had I been so exited to complete a 3 hour game. Normally I wouldn't even bother to complete a game this short as it probably is too boring. But this game is just pitched perfect.

Meh. Wasn't as good as the main games and there was a lot of boring and frustrating missions like the never ending escort mission and getting shot through every wall by the Strider in the end. But you should play if you wanna know what happens after HL2.
The continuation to HL2 isn't as bad as people make it, the final level feels dragged out for play time the rest of the game makes up for it, including new enemies and mechanics not seen before.
